docs.title: MarmosetBridge
docs.text: MarmosetBridge is a Blender addon that automates texture baking workflows between Blender and Marmoset Toolbag.

docs.title: Quick Links
docs.text:
• Installation
  • Getting Started
  • Features
  • Workflows
  • Changelog

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: MarmosetBridge streamlines your texture baking workflow by automating the export process from Blender to Marmoset Toolbag. Perfect for game artists who want to speed up their asset creation pipeline.

docs.title: Version History
docs.text: [Content coming soon]

docs.title: Features
docs.text: Overview of MarmosetBridge capabilities.

docs.title: Automated Export
docs.text: MarmosetBridge automatically exports your models to Marmoset Toolbag.

docs.title: Batch Processing
docs.text: Process multiple objects at once.

docs.title: Custom Configuration
docs.text: Tailor the workflow to your needs.

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text: Quick guide to get up and running with MarmosetBridge.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
Before you begin, make sure you have:

  • Blender 3.0 or higher
  • Marmoset Toolbag 4 or higher
  • Basic knowledge of baking workflows

docs.title: Download the Addon
docs.text:
1. Download the latest version
  2. Save the .zip file

docs.title: Install in Blender
docs.text:
1. Open Blender
  2. Go to Edit > Preferences > Add-ons
  3. Click Install
  4. Select the .zip file
  5. Enable the addon

docs.title: Setting Up Your Scene
docs.text: Prepare your high and low poly models.

docs.title: Configuring Export
docs.text: Set your export settings in the addon panel.

docs.title: Running the Bake
docs.text: Click the bake button and let MarmosetBridge handle the rest.

docs.title: Download
docs.text: [Download link coming soon]

docs.title: Install in Blender
docs.text:
1. Open Blender
  2. Go to Edit > Preferences > Add-ons
  3. Click "Install..."
  4. Select the downloaded .zip file
  5. Enable "MarmosetBridge"

docs.title: Workflows
docs.text: Common workflows and best practices.

docs.title: Basic Workflow
docs.text:
1. Prepare your models
  2. Configure settings
  3. Export and bake
